meanings.definition: To call out or greet loudly
meanings.sent1: I hallooed to my friend across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The coach would halloo instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to halloo whenever someone entered the room.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to halloo its arrival with booming sounds.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to halloo for help when he got lost in the forest.

meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout to attract attention
meanings.sent1: The hunter's halloo echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She let out a halloo when she spotted her lost dog.
meanings.sent3: The children's halloo could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent4: The halloo of the crowd filled the stadium with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The halloo of the lifeguard saved the drowning swimmer.
